answers.answer: I've been experiencing that as well. Like I can't take a full, deep breath. My midwife told me that it's expected. As the baby grows, the diaphragm and lungs are compressed. Your respiration rate changes as well.
It s normal it happens to me too with tachicardia. Try to Rest :)
I'm the same, I found sleeping in a more upright position helped at night. I have asthma as well which doesn't help lol

I'm going thru the same thing I have to sleep sitting up my Dr said its due to a big baby and that its completely normal but let me tell you this its my 8th child and this its the only one that did this to me....
Thank u ladies for answering.I met my midwife yesterday and she told me same thing that baby is growing and in result diaphragm is compressed.

It is common in 34 weeks , so never sleep on ur back always on side whether it's right side or left side as my midwife n doc said...I m 34 weeks too..it happened last night with me , I was accidentally on my back as I was too tide and wake up n hardly breath....gud luck mums...
Baby taken more room and blood flowing is strong very common and learn to breathe now practice your birthing breathing! It helps a ton...

question: Hi, I am 34 weeks pregnant and feels breathless sometimes. I am not suffering from asthma. Everything is ok. No high blood pressure or diabetes but I am worrying. My midwife has changed due to changing accomodation. I didn't meet her yet. Is this normal?? Any experience regarding this??
title: Short breaths
